website_summaries.verdict: Perfect specialty tool when you need to drive screws and perform work in tight quarters.
pros: With an angled driver, you will always have room to work, even in small spaces
Has a large hand grip area so you can maintain a hold on the tool when working at an odd angle
with the battery attached, meaning it's lightweight enough to use comfortably in tight spaces
cons: Much less power than a traditionally designed impact driver at 530 inch-pounds of torque

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but lacks power.
customer_reviews.text: Works well, but lacks power. Probably 15 percent of the time I have to use this driver to begin a screw and then have to switch to a non-90 degree driver to finish driving. Something about the 90 degree design appears to limit the power. However because of tight spaces I frequently have no choice but to start with this driver and if it fails to complete the driving, then switch to a larger driver after this one has gotten me more clearance.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Blow

customer_reviews.title: I use this at work on F-16s
customer_reviews.text: I use this angle impact driver at work regularly and it is a real time saver. We used to have to remove panel screws with a ratchet and it was slow and painful. Our tool guy put these in the aircraft tool boxes and made removing and installing the panels a breeze. This thing worked so good that a purchased one from Amazon for my rental house maintenance toolkit and I can't wait until there is a chance to drive screws in tight spots.
customer_reviews.author: Franklin W. Cathcart

customer_reviews.title: The old one was way way better!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am not really sure what everyone is so happy about this tool, but as a professional woodworker with almost 20 years of experience I don't see anything good besides the compact head and weight. The battery is killing all the advantages of it. Compact head, forget it - battery is huge so you literally can't fit it inside the small cabinet. Even if the space wide enough you must consider how tall is the tool.
customer_reviews.author: yuri rayzberg

customer_reviews.title: Awesome 90° impact driver makes working in tight spaces easy.
customer_reviews.text: Makita reliability. Works on any Makita 18V LXT (lithium-ion) battery. Great for getting in tight spaces and/or awkward areas. (530in-lbs/44 ft-lbs, 1/4" locking hex-shank speed chuck) Drives screws, bolts, nuts, drills holes. Best use is as a companion tool for Makita's 18v LXT drill/driver combo kit, to expand versatility. TOOL ONLY. Battery and charger not included, but may be purchased as a kit, or separately.
customer_reviews.author: J. Reyman

customer_reviews.title: Good for tight places
customer_reviews.text: Almost as much driving power as the regular impact. Super for getting into places where the regular impact won't fit. Can be used to drill holes with either the hex shank drill bits, or a hex-shank chuck and normal drill bits. Love the light feature. The smallest (1.5Ahr) batteries snap onto this tool. I'm happy with the battery life.

customer_reviews.title: Indispensable for tight spaces
customer_reviews.text: I'm a contractor. I have a stable of Makita tools and I love the impact drivers. But, as small as they are, they just don't fit in some tight spaces. I picked this up when I was building a deck and needed to hang a bunch of Simpson connectors but couldn't get the impact driver in the space. This one did the trick and saved me a bunch of time and, I'm sure, more than a couple busted up knuckles. Glad to add it to the stable.

product_meta.title: Makita XLT01Z 18V LXT Lithium-Ion Cordless Angle Impact Driver
product_meta.description: Style:Bare Tool OnlyThe Makita 18V LXT Lithium-Ion Cordless Angle Impact Driver (model XLT01Z, tool only) delivers cordless impact power into tough to reach spaces. The versatile XLT01Z packs plenty of torque for a wide range of fastening and loosening tasks, yet it weighs just 3.9 lbs. (with battery, sold separately) with a slim design and over one foot of tool extension. It's part of Makita's expanding 18V Lithium-Ion series, the world's largest cordless tool line-up powered by an 18V Lithium-Ion slide-style battery. Makita 18V Lithium-Ion batteries have the fastest charge times in their categories, so they spend more time working and less time sitting on the charger.
feature_bullets: Ideal for Fastening in Close Quarters
Makita-built motor delivers 530 in.lbs. of Max Torque
Variable speed (0-2,000 RPM & 0-3,000 IPM) for a wide range of fastening applications
Compact 2-1/8" angle head height for use in close quarters
Large paddle switch with soft grip provides increased comfort
